sys_hub_action_type_definition.description:
This action retrieves build timestamp of a given job from Jenkins Server.

Inputs:

  • Job Path - Name of the Job from which to retrieve build timestamp. Provide full path if your job is under a folder. E.g. UAT-jobs/Jpetstore_v1.0.
  • Build Number - Build number of a job from which to retrieve build timestamp. E.g. 15.

Outputs:

  • Build Timestamp - Will be set to the build timestamp retrieved from a given job.
  • Status - Will be set to “Success" if the request succeeds or “Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Will be populated when the status is "Error".

Error Messages:

  • The requested job doesn't exists or inaccessible.
  • Either build number or job path doesn't exists or not accessible.
  • Invalid username or password/token.
  • The Jenkins server is being restarted.

To use this action, the corresponding Jenkins connection and credential must be created and associated with the Jenkins Connection & Credential alias.

Disclaimer:Jenkins and Jenkins logo are a registered trademark of Jenkins.

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.
sys_hub_action_type_definition.name: Get Build Timestamp

This action retrieves build timestamp of a given job from Jenkins Server.

Inputs:

  • Job Path - Name of the Job from which to retrieve build timestamp. Provide full path if your job is under a folder. E.g. UAT-jobs/Jpetstore_v1.0.

  • Build Timestamp - Will be set to the build timestamp retrieved from a given job.
  • Status - Will be set to “Success" if the request succeeds or “Error" if a failure occurs.

To use this action, the corresponding Jenkins connection and credential must be created and associated with the Jenkins Connection & Credential alias.
